pages.text: Caupona introduces a tree and two shrubs, which are naturally found in different biomes. They share the common characteristic that respective fruits will gradually grow under their leaves.
Walnut trees grow in forests. They can be used as timbers, and their fruits are raw materials of oil.
Fig trees grow on plains. Breaking their chunks only yields sticks. Figs are fruits.
Wolfberry trees grows in windswept mountains. Also, breaking its chunks only yields sticks. Wolfberries are fruits, but are also used in a special stew recipe.
